item.description:
EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran. Please contact me here with your thoughts and ideas about this trip: jmmoran {{AT}} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (Please -- no phone calls PRIOR to the day of the event). FINISH YOUR NH 48 4,000 LIST WITH US!


ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS:
Difficulty -- Pick Your Trip!:


  • OPTION ONE, MT. ISOLATION ONLY -- Rocky Branch Trail Up, Glen Boulder Trail Down: 13.8 miles, about 3,503' total vertical climb. At a 1.5 mile / hour pace this is about a 9 1/4-hour hike.
    TRIP PLANNER LINK -- CLICK ON THE "RT Rocky Branch-Davis Path" TAB
    MAP LINK -- DESCENT IN RED

  • OPTION TWO, MT. ISOLATION ONLY -- Rocky Branch Trail Up, Boott Spur Trail Down: 13.7 miles, about 3,843' total vertical climb. At a 1.5 mile / hour pace this is about a 9 1/2-hour hike.
    TRIP PLANNER LINK -- CLICK ON THE "RB-Isolation-Boott Spur Down" TAB
    MAP LINK -- DESCENT IN GREEN

  • OPTION THREE, MT. ISOLATION + MT. WASHINGTON -- Rocky Branch Trail Up, Lion Head / Tuckerman Ravine Trails Down: 15.5 miles, about 4,781' total vertical climb. At a 1.5 mile / hour pace this is about a 10 1/2-hour hike.
    TRIP PLANNER LINK -- CLICK ON THE "wMt. Washington-Lions Head Down" TAB
    MAP LINK -- ASCENT-DESCENT IN PURPLE AND BLUE

  • OPTION FOUR, MT. ISOLATION + MT. WASHINGTON -- Rocky Branch Trail Up, Tuckerman Ravine Trail Down: 15.3 miles, about 4,781' total vertical climb. At a 1.5 mile / hour pace this is about a 10 1/2-hour hike.
    TRIP PLANNER LINK -- CLICK ON THE "wMt. Washington-Tuckermans Down" TAB
    MAP LINK -- ASCENT-DESCENT IN BLUE

  • OPTION FIVE, MT. ISOLATION + MT. WASHINGTON -- Rocky Branch Trail Up, Alpine Garden, Lion Head / Tuckerman Ravine Trails Down: 16.6 miles, about 4,751' total vertical climb. At a 1.5 mile / hour pace this is about a 11-hour hike.
    TRIP PLANNER LINK -- CLICK ON THE "wMt. Washington-AG Loop-LH Down" TAB
    MAP LINK -- LOOP ASCENT-DESCENT IN ORANGE, PURPLE AND BLUE



Google Maps -- Estimated Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the CAR SPOT, the AMC Pinkham Notch Visitor Center [ALL HIKERS DRIVE HERE FIRST] to the MEETUP LOCATION, the Rocky Branch Trailhead (where this hike begins), south of Pinkham Notch, NH.

The summit cairn on Mt Isolation, with Boott Spur and the summit of Mt Washington in the background.



TRIP SUMMARY / UPDATES (08/30/2010 3 p.m.): THIS EVENT HAS BEEN SIGNIFICANTLY UPDATED, based on suggestions / requests by a few of you. This trip is a cross-posted weekend camping event with the New England Hiking Meetup (NEHM) and the 4 Seasons Hiking Group, tied to the previous two days of hikes in the Whites. This trip begins at the steep north end of the Rocky Branch Trail that starts along Route 16 just north of Glen / Jackson, NH. At the junction with the Isolation Trail, we'll turn right at the Rocky Branch Shelter #2, turn left along the Davis Path to the Mt. Isolation summit, and return using one of the five options indicated above, with all routes ending at the the AMC Pinkham's Notch Visitor's Center where we will have spotted cars.

I was galvanized by a recent trip report via the Montalban Ridge to Mt. Isolation and the Boott Spur from fellow hiker-website poster Andrew Lavigne -- instead of lamenting an less inspiring visit to lonely Mt. Isolation, why not include its showy, ostentatious neighbor? And (given this will be my 48th!), why not include semi-famous geological and geographical features under Mt. Washington's shadow, such as Boott Spur, Ball Crag and the Alpine Garden? You can visit Mt. Washington and return three ways, or choose shorter trips that include two other descents from Montalban Ridge -- Glen Boulder or Boott Spur trails. Sign up and indicate your preference in your RSVP. The rain date for this event will be September 12th. NOTE: This is a dog-friendly hike (i.e., Mike is coming!).


The Mt. Isolation summit sign (that's a little tricky to see).



ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items, sun screen, bug repellent. Wear multiple layers of synthetic materials for warmth; trekking poles may be helpful gear for this hike. TEST YOUR LIGHTS!


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

TRAIL DESCRIPTIONS AND TRIP REPORTS
Link, Trail Description -- Rocky Branch Trail
Link, Trail Description -- Glen Boulder Trail
Link, Trail Description -- Nelson Crag Trail
Link, Trail Description -- Alpine Garden Trail
Link, Trail Description -- Lion's Head Trail
Link, Trail Description -- Tuckerman Ravine Trail
Link, Trail Description -- The Eastern Mt. Washington Alpine Loop

Link, Up-To-Date Trail Conditions

INFORMATION LINKS, MT. ISOLATION
Link, SummitPost
Link, Hike The Whites Page
Link, New England 4,000 Peak-Bagging
Link, Appalachian Mountain Club
Link, Hike New Hampshire
Link, Peakbagger
Link, Wikipedia

INFORMATION LINKS, MT. WASHINGTON
Link, SummitPost
Link, Hike The Whites Page
Link, New England 4,000 Peak-Bagging
Link, Appalachian Mountain Club
Link, Peakbagger
Link, Wikipedia



A view into the abyss ... at the Tuckerman Ravine Junction.



NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT. BY ATTENDING YOU'VE AGREED THAT YOU'VE READ INFORMATION PRESENTED HERE AND AT OUR GUIDELINES -- CLICK THE "ABOUT" LINK AT LEFT.

See you there! Julie.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: NEW HAMPSHIRE SERIES: Mt. Isolation to Mt. Washington - Alpine Crags and Gardens
